areaSection: Pilar de La Horadada sits on the southern Costa Blanca, approximately 50km south of Alicante airport. This coastal town has evolved into a mature property market characterized by stable prices and consistent rental demand. The Mediterranean climate delivers 300+ days of sunshine annually, with mild winters (average 12°C) and warm summers (28°C). The town balances tourism appeal with residential authenticity—neither overdeveloped like Benidorm nor remote like inland villages. The beachfront location provides direct access to multiple Blue Flag beaches, while the town centre maintains working markets and local restaurants alongside international amenities. Geography favors the investor: close enough to Alicante for airport access and services, yet far enough south to retain character and affordability. The surrounding region offers championship golf courses, water sports facilities, and a protected natural park nearby. This positioning—accessible yet established—explains why Pilar de La Horadada maintains a robust rental market year-round.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Pilar de La Horadada balances beach convenience with practical infrastructure. Mornings begin with Mediterranean beach access; the town's multiple Blue Flag beaches are within a 15-minute walk. The expat community is substantial and English-speaking—you'll encounter British, Nordic, and German residents integrated throughout the town. Shopping is straightforward: Mercadona and Lidl supermarkets handle daily needs, while Tuesday and Saturday markets offer fresh produce and local goods. Healthcare is reliable with a regional hospital 30 minutes away and several private clinics staffed with English-speaking doctors. Restaurants range from fish-and-chip shops catering to British visitors to authentic Spanish paella establishments. Public transport connects to nearby towns, though most residents use cars for flexibility. The social calendar includes golf clubs, beach clubs, and established expatriate social groups. This isn't resort-style tourism—it's a functioning residential community where you can live comfortably, access high-quality services, and tap into a ready market of holiday renters seeking authentic coastal living.
investmentSection: The investment case rests on three pillars: acquisition value, rental income, and appreciation. At €5,857/m², you're purchasing at 40% discount versus Spanish island properties (Mallorca, Ibiza, Canary Islands command €9,000-12,000/m²). Rental potential is concrete: comparable 2-bedroom apartments in Pilar de La Horadada achieve €800-900 per week in peak season and €500-600 off-season, producing annualized income of €30,000-35,000. That yields approximately 7-8.5% gross return on your €410,000 investment—competitive in European real estate. Costa Blanca has appreciated 8% year-on-year consistently; over five years, your €410,000 investment could appreciate to €602,000 in capital value alone, before accounting for accumulated rental income. Market demand remains robust: 2-million holiday visitors annually visit the Costa Blanca, and Pilar de La Horadada's established infrastructure supports high occupancy rates. This isn't speculative—it's data-driven investment in a proven, mature coastal market.
conclusion: This 2-bedroom apartment at €410,000 represents a quantifiable investment opportunity, not a speculative purchase. You're acquiring premium specifications at 40% below island-market pricing, positioning yourself to capture 7-8.5% gross rental yields while benefiting from documented 8% annual capital appreciation. The property's turnkey condition eliminates renovation risk. Pilar de La Horadada's established infrastructure—healthcare, services, international amenities—supports both absentee ownership and part-time residency. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Pilar de La Horadada prioritizes practical convenience. Essential services—healthcare, supermarkets, transport—are accessible within minutes. This established infrastructure supports both resident comfort and rental guest satisfaction.

healthcare.text: Healthcare access meets high standards. Hospital de Torrevieja, the regional acute-care facility, is approximately 28 kilometers away with 24-hour emergency services and English-speaking staff. Closer to the property, several private clinics operate in the immediate area, offering consultations, basic diagnostics, and specialist referrals. Pharmacies are abundant throughout town, and many doctors in the region speak English as a standard practice. Expat residents commonly access private health insurance (often cheaper than UK equivalents) for routine care and prescriptions. The combination of public hospital capacity and accessible private options creates a reliable healthcare environment comparable to Northern European standards.

Parking is available in the town and typically not problematic. Internally, Pilar de La Horadada is compact and walkable—the town center and beaches are accessible on foot.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om vastgoed te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca attracts 2 million annual visitors, maintains consistent 8% year-on-year price appreciation, and offers documented rental yields of 7-8.5% in established towns like Pilar de La Horadada. The region combines lifestyle appeal with measurable investment returns, particularly for properties positioned in proven rental markets.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders vastgoed kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, without restrictions. EU citizens can purchase property freely. Non-EU nationals require a Spanish NIE (fiscal identification number), obtain a Spanish bank account, and work with local legal counsel—processes simplified by established expat communities on the Costa Blanca.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van het kopen van vastgoed in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs total approximately 8-10% of property price: 6-7% transfer tax, 1-2% notary and registration fees, 0.5-1% legal fees. A €410,000 property incurs €32,800-41,000 in additional costs. These are standard, predictable expenses included in Spanish property transactions.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes. EU citizens can secure Spanish mortgages at 3-4.5% interest rates with 70-80% loan-to-value ratios. Non-EU nationals can access mortgages through private banks and investment firms, often at slightly higher rates. Most Costa Blanca property professionals facilitate mortgage introductions.

faqs.question: Wat is het huurinkomstenpotentieel van dit vastgoed?
faqs.answer: Comparable 2-bedroom apartments in Pilar de La Horadada achieve €800-900/week in peak season (June-September) and €500-600/week off-season, producing annualized income of €30,000-35,000. This generates 7-8.5% gross yield on the €410,000 purchase price—competitive European rental returns.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Monthly costs for a resident couple average €800-1,200: €400-500 rent/utilities, €200-250 groceries (30% cheaper than UK), €150-200 dining/entertainment. Property taxes run approximately 0.4% annually (€1,640 on this property). Healthcare through private insurance costs €50-80/month. Overall cost of living is 25-35% below UK equivalents.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van Nederland?
faqs.answer: Alicante airport is 48 kilometers from this property, with direct 2-hour flights to UK airports (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol). Budget airlines (Ryanair, EasyJet, Wizz Air) operate 30+ weekly routes, making UK trips convenient and affordable (€40-80 return fares during off-peak periods).

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean climate with 300+ annual sunshine days. Summers (June-September) average 28-30°C; winters (December-February) average 12-14°C. Rainfall occurs primarily October-March (300mm annually). The climate supports year-round outdoor activities and contributes to consistent holiday rental demand throughout the year.

faqs.question: How quickly can I start renting this property after purchase?
faqs.answer: Turnkey condition enables rental readiness within 2-4 weeks of legal completion. Register with holiday rental platforms (Airbnb, Booking.com, HomeAway), photograph the property, and establish booking management systems. Many Costa Blanca investors hire local property management companies (€80-120/month) to handle guest communication and logistics remotely.
